name: symantec-messaging-gateway
label: Symantec Messaging Gateway
description: Symantec Messaging Gateway is an email security solution which provides inbound and outbound messaging security. Also it can perform containment and corrective actions like block Domain/Email/IP or unblock Domain/Email/IP

fields.title: Server URL
fields.description: URL of the Symantec Messaging Gateway server to which you will connect and perform automated operations.
fields.name: base_url

fields.title: Username
fields.description: Username for accessing Symantec Messaging Gateway to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
fields.name: user_name

fields.title: Password
fields.description: Password for accessing Symantec Messaging Gateway to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
fields.name: password

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. Defaults to True.
fields.name: verify_ssl

operations.title: Block Email
operations.description: Adds an email address that you have specified to the list of bad senders on Symantec Messaging Gateway.

parameters.title: Email Address
parameters.description: Specify the email address that you want to block, i.e., add to the list of bad senders on Symantec Messaging Gateway.
parameters.name: email_id

operations.title: Unblock Email
operations.description: Removes an email address you have specified from the list of bad senders on Symantec Messaging Gateway.

parameters.title: Email Address
parameters.description: Specify the email address that you want to unblock, i.e., remove from the list of bad senders on Symantec Messaging Gateway.
parameters.name: email_id

operations.title: Block Domain
operations.description: Adds a domain you have specified to the list of bad senders on Symantec Messaging Gateway.

parameters.title: Domain
parameters.description: Specify the name of the domain that you want to block, i.e., add to the list of bad senders on Symantec Messaging Gateway.
parameters.name: domain

operations.title: Unblock Domain
operations.description: Removes a domain you have specified from the list of bad senders on Symantec Messaging Gateway.

parameters.title: Domain
parameters.description: Specify the name of the domain that you want to unblock, i.e., remove from the list of bad senders on Symantec Messaging Gateway.
parameters.name: domain

operations.title: Block IP
operations.description: Adds an IP address you have specified to the list of bad senders on Symantec Messaging Gateway.

parameters.title: IP Address
parameters.description: Specify the IP address that you want to block, i.e., add to the list of bad senders on Symantec Messaging Gateway.
parameters.name: ip

operations.title: Unblock IP
operations.description: Removes an IP address you have specified from the list of bad senders on Symantec Messaging Gateway.

parameters.title: IP Address
parameters.description: Specify the IP address that you want to unblock, i.e., remove from the list of bad senders on Symantec Messaging Gateway.
parameters.name: ip

operations.title: Quick Audit Log Search
operations.description: Searches for audit logs from Symantec Messaging gateway based on the filter criteria you have specified. This operation returns the main event fields.

parameters.title: Search By
parameters.name: mandatoryFilterId
parameters.tooltip: Select the search filter based on which you want to search the audit logs in Search By Symantec Messaging Gateway. You can choose from the following options: Sender, Recipient, Subject, Audit ID, Connection IP, or Logical IP.
parameters.description: Select the search filter based on which you want to search the audit logs in Search By Symantec Messaging Gateway. You can choose from the following options: Sender, Recipient, Subject, Audit ID, Connection IP, or Logical IP.

parameters.title: Search Value
parameters.name: mandatoryFilterValue
parameters.tooltip: Specify the value using which you want to search the audit logs in Symantec Messaging Gateway, based on the filter selected in the 'Search By' drop-down list. For example, enter baduser@badomain.com if you have selected 'Sender' in the 'Search By' drop-down list.
parameters.description: Specify the value using which you want to search the audit logs in Symantec Messaging Gateway, based on the filter selected in the 'Search By' drop-down list. For example, enter baduser@badomain.com if you have selected 'Sender' in the 'Search By' drop-down list.

parameters.title: Start Time
parameters.name: start_time
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Select the DateTime using which you want to filter the result set to only include only those items that have been created after the specified timestamp.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the DateTime using which you want to filter the result set to only include only those items that have been created after the specified timestamp.

parameters.title: End Time
parameters.name: end_time
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Select the DateTime using which you want to filter the result set to only include only those items that have been created before the specified timestamp.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the DateTime using which you want to filter the result set to only include only those items that have been created before the specified timestamp.

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.name: entriesPerPage
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of results, per page, that this operation should return. By default, this option is set as 10. Note: Possible values are 10, 25, 50, or 100.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of results, per page, that this operation should return. By default, this option is set as 10.

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful for pagination and for getting a subset of items. By default, this is set as 1.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful for pagination and for getting a subset of items. By default, this is set as 1.
